conclusion: Understanding the behavior of light in the semi-cylindrical object and determining refractive index.
The object is semi-cylindrical with radius R, light enters along axis OA to point C at distance sqrt(3)/3 R from O.
Light travels along axis OA and enters the semi-cylindrical object, reaching point C.
Light must undergo total internal reflection at point C to stop emitting from the right side.
Total internal reflection occurs when angle of incidence is greater than critical angle, theta_c = sin^(-1)(1/n).
Distance OC = sqrt(3)/3 R suggests angle theta at point C is 60 degrees.
For total internal reflection, angle of incidence theta must be equal to or greater than critical angle.
Set theta_c = 60 degrees, using critical angle formula: sin(60 degrees) = 1/n.
The refractive index n of the transparent object is 2/sqrt(3).
